Click Here. Search for: New Residents Welcome Mayor & City Council Agendas Minutes City Council Live Contact City Hall Ordinances Departments Administration Legal Counsel Building Department Cemetery Osceola Fire Department Municipal Airport Parks & Recreation Osceola Municipal Golf Course Osceola Police Department Public Library Streets Waste Water Solid Waste Zoning Employment Events FAQ Osceola News Forms & Permits Osceola Municipal Golf Course Home → City of Osceola Departments → Osceola Municipal Golf Course OSCEOLA MUNICIPAL GOLF COURSE Nine (9) Hole Public Course The Osceola Municipal Golf Course was built in 1961 on a great piece of property that includes elevation changes, mature trees, a creek, and ponds. This facility has many additional features such as a practice area for putting, netted driving area, and cart sheds that Season Pass Holders may rent space for their personal cart. The Clubhouse is available to rent for special events.  Wedding receptions, class reunions, graduation parties, funeral receptions, holiday parties, or your own golf event are just a few examples of Facility Rental possibilities. We look forward to what another year of golf may bring!!! *Tentative Season Schedule For Clubhouse is April- Mid-October* **Please note that Clubhouse hours may vary during the season due to weather** Call Ahead at 641-342-3717 *** We stop renting out the rental carts an hour and half before sunset *** Osceola Municipal Golf Course 400 E. Fayette Street Osceola, Iowa  50213 (641) 342-3717 Out of Season Contact City Hall at 641-342-2377 Extension: 1003 golfcourse@osceolaia.net Golf Season Pass 2025 GREEN FEES 9 Holes, without cart:  $15.00 18 Holes, without cart:  $20.00 CART RENTAL 9 Holes:  $15.00 per seat 18 Holes: $15.00 per seat 2025 Tournament Schedule LEAGUE INFORMATION – Contact Taylor Andrew at 641-414-9486 for questions regarding League’s. Banquet Room Rental Osceola Municipal Golf Course offer a convenient location for your reception, private function, business function, and much more.  We recommend utilizing a professional caterer for your larger events but there kitchen for use with the rental of the banquet room. For pricing please contact City Hall at 641-342-2377 Extension: 1003. Course Rental Below are the rates and time frame to close the Course for a Private Event $750 – Half Day (8:00 a.m. – 12:30 p.m. or 12:30 p.m. – 5:00 p.m.) $1,000 – Full Day (8:00 a.m. – 5:00 p.m.) *Any Private Event, where the Course is closed, must strictly adhere to the associated time frame.  The Clubhouse will remain open but all private participants must be off the Course.* All questions about renting contact the Clubhouse Manager at 641-342-2377 Extension : 1003. STAFF: Cheyenne Thornton – Clubhouse Manager Darron Toney, G reenskeeper We will advertise for Clubhouse Attendants & Grounds Staff mid-February of each year. ﻿Living on the Green: Golf Course Communities in the Pensacola area Skip to main content Kick off fall with savings! $35 app fees through September 30th. (850) 473-3983 Owner Login Tenant Login Apply For A Rental Home Property Management Property Management Pricing Available Rentals Homes for Rent Register Online Moving to Pensacola Military Housing Rental Criteria Owners Owner Resources Owner Portal Owner FAQs Tenants Tenant Resources Maintenance Requests Maintenance Tips and Troubleshooting Tenant FAQs Renew Lease Real Estate Services Buyers Sellers Investors Search For Homes Instant Valuation Vendors Vendor Resources Vendor Portal About Us Our Company Testimonials Contact Blog All Categories Investors Renting Community MENU (850) 473-3983 Owner Login Tenant Login Home Property Management Property Management Pricing Available Rentals Homes for Rent Register Online Moving to Pensacola Military Housing Rental Criteria Owners Owner Resources Owner Portal Owner FAQs Tenants Tenant Resources Maintenance Requests Maintenance Tips and Troubleshooting Tenant FAQs Renew Lease Real Estate Services Buyers Sellers Investors Search For Homes Instant Valuation Vendors Vendor Resources Vendor Portal About Us Our Company Testimonials Contact Blog All Categories Investors Renting Community Youtube Instagram Facebook Tiktok Property Management Blog ﻿Living on the Green: Golf Course Communities in the Pensacola area By Nicole St. Aubin Monday, November 18, 2024 For golf enthusiasts and those seeking a serene lifestyle, residing on or near a golf course can be a dream come true. The Pensacola area and its surrounding suburbs feature several stunning golf course communities that blend luxurious living with access to beautiful greens. Catering to various lifestyles and preferences, these communities are ideal for avid golfers, retirees, and families alike. With beautiful homes, picturesque landscapes, and a vibrant community spirit, living in these golf course communities offers a fulfilling experience for anyone looking for a slice of paradise in Florida. Pensacola Country Club, Pensacola Pensacola Country Club is Florida's oldest private golf club, featuring a premier 18-hole championship course along Pensacola Bay. Renowned for its scenic beauty and historic charm, the club offers exclusive amenities, including a clubhouse, fine dining, and tennis courts, providing a sophisticated golfing experience. Due to the club's unique topography, located between Barrancas Ave. and Pensacola Bay, housing options nearby are limited compared to other golf courses in the area. A popular choice is the Bayshore condominium, built in the 1960s. Additionally, several smaller communities border the club, including Country Club Estates, developed in the 1950s, and prestigious neighborhoods such as Star Lake, Harbourview, Chanterene, and Country Club Circle, which are situated along the golf course and Pensacola Bay. Due to the wide range of housing options nearby, property prices vary significantly. Scenic Hills Country Club, Pensacola Scenic Hills Country Club is a semi-private 18-hole course located in Northeast Pensacola, renowned for its challenging design and lush surroundings. The club offers both golf and social memberships and features a clubhouse with event spaces, creating a welcoming environment for both serious golfers and casual players. The surrounding Scenic Hills community, developed in the 1960s and 1970s, includes a variety of housing options. In the past year, home sales in this area ranged from $390,000 to $640,000, with some executive homes priced significantly higher. Additionally, the neighborhood offers more affordable options, including townhomes and patio home communities, which are conveniently situated near the course. Osceola Municipal Golf Course, Pensacola, FL 32506 Osceola Municipal Golf Course, owned by the City of Pensacola, is a public 18-hole golf course offering affordable golfing in West Pensacola. Known for its well-maintained greens and welcoming atmosphere, it’s a favorite among both locals and visitors. Surrounding the course is the Osceola Country Club Estates, a well-established neighborhood primarily developed between the 1950s and 1970s. Over the past year, homes in this community sold for prices ranging from $125,000 to $360,000. Marcus Pointe Golf Club, Pensacola, FL 32505 Marcus Pointe Golf Club, located in central Pensacola, is a semi-private course renowned for its rolling fairways and scenic woodlands. This 18-hole course provides a challenging yet enjoyable experience for golfers of all skill levels. In addition to the golf course, the club offers amenities such as a pro shop, restaurant, and event space. The surrounding Marcus Pointe neighborhood, developed in the 1990s, features a wide variety of homes. Recent sales have ranged from $260,000 for a fixer-upper to $600,000 for an estate home with a pool overlooking the 17th green. Perdido Bay Golf Course, Pensacola, FL 32507 Perdido Bay Golf Course is a public 18-hole championship course located in southwest Pensacola, near the Gulf of Mexico. Renowned for hosting PGA Tour events, it features a challenging layout and stunning views of Perdido Bay. The course includes a pro shop, dining facilities, and hosts frequent community events. Neighboring townhomes in Perdido Bay Villas were developed in the 1970s, while the single-family homes in Perdido Bay Country Club were largely constructed between the 1980s and early 2000s. With diverse housing choices, properties are available in all price ranges. Over the past year, properties sold between $145,000 for a fixer-upper townhome to $675,000 for a spacious 4,000-square-foot home on the golf course. Lost Key Golf Club, Perdido Key, FL 32507 Lost Key Golf Club is a resort-style 18-hole course located in Perdido Key. Known for its environmentally friendly Audubon-certified design, it offers a challenging layout with narrow fairways and protected wetlands. The club provides luxurious amenities, including a clubhouse, pro shop, and dining options, perfect for golfers seeking a coastal retreat near the beautiful white sand beaches of Perdido Key. With condos, townhomes, and single family homes in a variety of neighborhoods surrounding Lost Key Golf Club, including Lost Key Plantation, Lost Key Golf and Bleach Club. Sales prices in the previous year ranged between $405,000 for a condo at Lost Key to $712,000 Tiger Point Golf Club – Gulf Breeze Tiger Point Golf Club in Gulf Breeze is known for its challenging course and scenic location along Santa Rosa Sound. It weaves through several communities, including Champions Green, Fairways, Oak Pointe, and Tiger Point Village, offering a mix of golf course and waterfront homes. In the past year, home sales in these neighborhoods ranged from $335,000 to $1,000,000, with some current listings priced even higher. Residents enjoy amenities like a clubhouse, pool, and tennis courts, along with close proximity to beaches, shopping, and dining, making it an ideal location for golfers and outdoor enthusiasts. Just to the east of Gulf Breeze, you’ll also find Hidden Village Golf Course in Navarre! Stonebrook Village – Pace Stonebrook Village is a gated golf course community in Pace, Florida, offering a range of homes from patio homes to estate-style residences. Developed in the early 1990s, with over 600 homes and occasional new construction opportunities, the community is built around an 18-hole privately owned golf course, clubhouse, pool, and tennis courts. Special events like golf cart parades and holiday contests foster community spirit. Over the past year, home sales ranged from $400,000 to $825,000, making Stonebrook Village an attractive option for families and retirees seeking luxury living. Tanglewood East and West- Milton Tanglewood is a smaller golf community located in Milton, Florida, 32570, consisting of fewer than 200 homes. The community is situated among an 18-hole golf course, Tanglewood Golf and Country Club, offering a peaceful and intimate setting for residents. Home sales in Tanglewood over the past year ranged from $300,000 to $400,000, making it an affordable option for those seeking a golf course lifestyle in a smaller neighborhood. If you're interested in exploring homes in these golf course communities or have any questions about real estate in the Pensacola area, reach out for more information . Our Pensacola realtors will be happy to find you a home to purchase on one of Pensacola’s many greens. Share Author Nicole St. Aubin Operations Director, Broker Nicole St. Aubin joined the Realty Masters team in 2004. She is a licensed Florida Real Estate Broker and is the Director of Operations at Realty Masters. Nicole graduated from University of West Florida in 2007 with a BS in
							Communication Arts. She has continued her education in the real estate and property management industry, earning several certifications and designations including the Military Relocation Professional, At Home With Diversity
							Certification, and Cert... Nicole St. Aubin joined the Realty Masters team in 2004. She is a licensed Florida Real Estate Broker and is the Director of Operations at Realty Masters. Nicole graduated from University of West Florida in 2007 with a BS in
							Communication Arts. She has continued her education in the real estate and property management industry, earning several certifications and designations including the Military Relocation Professional, At Home With Diversity
							Certification, and Certified Residential Specialist designation, which less than 1% of Realtors earn. As a Realtor for 17 years, she has experience in helping everyone, from first time homebuyers to seasoned investors selling their
							income-producing properties. With her expertise in both investment sales and rental properties, Nicole is seen to be a local industry expert in the Pensacola area rental market. She served 6 years on the Pensacola Association of Realtors Board of Directors and
							continues to be an active board member with the Pensacola Chapter of the National Association of Residential Property Managers. In addition to being chosen as one of InWeekly’s Rising Stars, Nicole has been featured in Florida Trend
							Magazine, the Pensacola News Journal, and WEAR TV. Nicole has a passion for community work and has also volunteered with several Pensacola area non-profits including Big Brothers Big Sisters, Guardian Ad Litem, Pensacola Young
							Professionals, and Make-a-Wish Foundation. As a nature enthusiast and workaholic, she loves photographing everything from houses to the sunrise. When she is not working, she is spending time with her husband and two young daughters. Nicole truly cares about providing safe,
							affordable, and fair housing for all in the Pensacola area.
